trans-unit.source: Provides a serializable type of endpoint address that is WS-Addressing V1 compliant and that enables it to be exposed as part of the service contract.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress> is not serializable nor is it tied to a particular version of the WS-Addressing specification.

This class provides a WS-Addressing V1 compliant wrapper for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress> that is serializable (implements the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable> interface) and bound to the WS-Addressing V1 wire format.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress10.FromEndpointAddress%28System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress%29> method does the wrapping and the <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress10.ToEndpointAddress%2A> method does the unwrapping, allowing the recovery of the endpoint address after it is serialized on the wire.

[!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] also supplies a class that provides a serializable type, <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddressAugust2004>, which is WS-Addressing August 2004 compliant for legacy purposes.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress10"></xref> class with a specified endpoint address.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress> is not tied to a particular version of the WS-Addressing specification or bound to a particular wire format.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress"></xref> used to initialize the instance of this class.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress10"></xref> class that contains the specified endpoint address.
is `null`.
Returns an XML-qualified name that describes the XML representation of the version 1.0 endpoint address from a specified cached schema.
This method is required by the serialization contract.
It must be public to be seen by the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer>.
It is not intended to be called by developers.
A <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchema"></xref> that contains a cache of the XML schema definition language (XSD) schemas for the endpoint address.
A <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> that describes the XML representation of the endpoint address.
xmlSchemaSet is `null`.
Retrieves the endpoint address contained in this serializable type.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress"></xref> used to initialize the instance of this class.
Returns `null`.
This member supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> from which the endpoint address is obtained.
This member supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> to which the current endpoint address is saved.
